intro: Stilpnopappus laiseae, commonly known as the Laisea sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and high sunlight exposure. Its leaves are usually gray-green with a fuzzy texture, aiding in water conservation. The showy yellow ray florets attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, playing a role in ecological pollination networks.
